title: KiaKia
author: KiaKia
content: Stop using Stake website right now if you have an account on this gambling website, it's been compromised and they have lost a lot of money due to attack from a hacker, millions of dollars in BNB and other crypto assets are gone. https://www.theblock.co/post/248998/betting-platform-stake-sees-over-15-million-in-suspicious-funds-outflowI doubt that they have seen a solution to stop the attack yet, and I am quite surprised that a casino can be a target, I don't know how this might help, maybe you are still trying to make some deposit on the platform? Be safe.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Two different threads have already been created concerning the hacked that recently occurred in stake.com JUST IN: World's largest crypto casino, Stakeâ€¤com reportedly hacked for $41.3 mi Stake.com Hot wallet robbed for 16Million + usdSo do well to lock your thread and join the already existing threads for discussion.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Lock this topic: This is a thread about it:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5465626.msg62794441#msg62794441

comments.author: bhadz
comments.body: There's already a thread that's made about this topic earlier than you: Stake.com Hot wallet robbed for 40Million + usd (Confirmed by stake)It is also being discussed on their announcement thread: Stake.com - The Leading Crypto Casino

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.created_time: September 04, 2023, 09:49:42 PMLast edit: September 04, 2023, 10:25:43 PM by Saint-loup
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on September 04, 2023, 05:42:06 PMLock this topic: This is a thread about it:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5465626.msg62794441#msg62794441Why do you want him to lock his topic, you are working for the moderation now lol ? The one you are pointing out is not in the gambling section but in a deep small one where only few users post. It's a very big news, and gamblers need to be aware of it, more important than many of those spammy threads here at least. But KiaKia should update his topic because it seems 40+ million USD have been hacked for now.
